topics.body:
The uncanny valley of tyranny is interesting.

An example: Crime and punishment.

Two extremes, on the one end you have what super progressive places like Norway do and basically be super nice to prisoners. It seems to work.

On the other you do what despots do and flog people. 
Not pleasant at all. But I haven't seen evidence it doesn't work that doesn't simply reference the countries it occurs in being more violent anyway (which I doubt is due to how they punish crimes versus other factors).

But what is the middle? Presumably it would be what most 1st and 2nd world countries do: lock you in a cage for several years where you are likely to be raped and may never see the sun. And where you become a criminal and more likely to commit crime later. 

I'll take the flogging thank you
